Case reference: 2016018567.CaseDesc: Mekayla was last seen at the STC Bus Depot in Yorkton at 1:45 p.m. on April 12, 2016. She went to school in the morning, but left shortly after arriving. She went to several businesses in Yorkton throughout the morning, then returned to school around noon. She bought lunch at the restaurant in the bus depot, but did not get on a bus that day. Mekayla left the bus depot in the early afternoon and hasn't been seen since.

Case reference: 1996000260.CaseDesc: On March 17, 1995, Jay Boyle, Michael Cummings, Daniel Higgins, Jamie Lefebvre, Robert Rumbolt, and Chad Smith were seen for the last time walking towards the East Shore Marina in Pickering, Ontario. It is believed that the six young men boarded a boat that subsequently capsized.

Shoes: Red, Sneakers, Sneakers made of suede
Scar: Ears, Piercing scar on left ear

Hat: Black, Baseball hat-" Detroit Red Wings"

Shoes: Canvas, Black, White, Running shoes, brand "Adidas"

Case reference: 2005003799.CaseDesc: On August 6, 1975, an unidentified woman was found on the beach of Confederation Park of Lake Ontario in Hamilton. Her post-mortem weight was recorded as being 150 lbs. however, this measurement may not represent her actual living weight due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy. Her appendix was not present. She may have been in the water for up to a year.

Teeth: Gold Visible, Several molar teeth are missing and she has a gold crown on her upper left premolar
Jewelry: Metal, Gold, Silver, Aluminum, Stainless Steel, Gruen brand watch model N225
Gold, Gold, Ring size 6, emerald stone with small diamonds on each sides
Gold, Gold, Yellow, 14kt wedding band, Blue River brand, size 6.5
Shoes: Brown, Oxford orthopedic shoes with 1.5 inch heel

Case reference: 2006025899.CaseDesc: Robin Windross has not been seen since November 1977. He has an intellectual age of about 6 years old, speaks with a strong speech impediment and is difficult to understand. He may have left Huronia Regional Centre because he was concerned about being transferred in the facility to a unit with mostly adults. He had always been housed with children.

Case reference: 2012020018.CaseDesc: Sahil Sharma has been missing from the Newton area of Surrey, B.C. since November 13, 2008.  On the day Sahil disappeared, he had attended to Kwantlen University in Surrey, B.C. to pay for his upcoming semester to study Information Technology.  Sahil did not have any known drug or alcohol addictions and no known mental health issues.  Sahil's disappearance is highly out of character and all avenues of investigation have not provided any information on his whereabouts.

Sweater: Grey, Red, Red stripes on the neck
Tattoo: Right Forearm, "RAM" written in Hindi symbols

Case reference: 2014005674.CaseDesc: Ms. Loughran went missing some time on or after March 4, 2006, when she was last seen. Ms. Loughran left the Aspen Grove area of Grovedale, Alberta, in a white Chevrolet truck and was never seen or heard from again.

Case reference: 2006023299.CaseDesc: Edward Nelson was last seen on June 21, 1987, in South Bay on Lake Nipigon. He was on a fishing boat heading southwest to go fishing and failed to return.

Case reference: 2019037175.CaseDesc: On April 8, 2005, the blood and brain matter from a male was found on the outer deck of a ferry travelling from Horseshoe Bay to Departure Bay in British Columbia. A loaded revolver with one spent round was found nearby. He may have worn a black leather cap, and was likely despondent when last seen alive.

Case reference: 2015011650.CaseDesc: On June 15, 2000, the Coast Guard noticed the body of a male floating in the waters of the Saint Lawrence River near the Port of Montreal wharf.

Teeth: Other, Sup. maxillary- dental prosthesis. Inf. maxillary- no teeth
Jewelry: Brown, Wooden cross pendant with leather cord.
Socks: Green, Grey, Green top with grey foot
Boots: Brown, Isolated 120, plus protector, with laces
Sweater: Cotton, Black, T-shirt, written "BEAT MOLSON DRY" "BEAT STAFF MOLSON DRY"
Coat: Nylon, Black, Synthetic lining, imitation sheep. Hooded, size medium

Case reference: 2016066833.CaseDesc: On April 26, 1982, an unidentified male was discovered in the Detroit River, near Fighting Island. His post-mortem length was estimated as being between 5'6"-5'8",  however, this measurement may not represent his actual living weight due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy. It is estimated he was in the water for no more than 6 months.

Jacket: Parka or hooded jacket, which had both a zipper and snap fasteners

Case reference: 2014000022.CaseDesc: Cynthia Albena Audy was last seen getting into a vehicle in the North End area of Winnipeg, Manitoba on October 28th, 2004.

Tattoo: Left Upper Arm, Heart and cross

Case reference: 2016058794.CaseDesc: Raymond Raine was reported missing in 2016 after family members had not heard from him in several years. Raymond has ties to Maskwacis, Alberta, but was last known to be in the Fort Saskatchewan, Alberta area.

Case reference: 2018008230.CaseDesc: On September 1, 1993, Trevor Chase was seen for the last time by his relatives in Truro, Nova Scotia. Trevor’s family believed that he may have been residing in Vancouver, British Columbia, in 1994.

Case reference: 2014005457.CaseDesc: On July 7, 2010, Roosdianajati and Didik Harijanto were seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario. Roosdianajati and Didik were scheduled to work, but did not show up for their shifts.

Case reference: 2014001281.CaseDesc: On April 7, 1982, a volunteer with Meals on Wheels reported to the police that, despite numerous attempts, they had not been able to contact Thelma Haskins. Police checked her home, however she was not there and they found nothing suspicious.  None of Mrs. Haskins' friends had seen her, and she had not frequented any local businesses.  Ground searches of the area and of the walking trails Mrs. Haskins frequented did not reveal any trace of her.  Mrs. Haskins has not been located.

Hair: Black, Short, hair is turning grey

Case reference: 2014002433.CaseDesc:
On April 13, 1995, Wendy Smith was last seen leaving the Fantasia strip club
formerly located on 10097 Yonge Street in Richmond Hill, Ontario. Wendy had 
her first shift there that night, and was due to return to her home in Toronto later
that night, but never arrived.

Scar: Left Upper Arm, Two six inch scars
Foreign Object: Cheek, Metal plate on the right

Case reference: 2023001420.CaseDesc: On November 7, 2022, Sohail Shahid was seen for the last time at Terrapin Point, American Falls, Niagara Falls, New York. Witnesses observed Sohail jumping over the railing. At the time of his disappearance, Sohail was despondent.

Case reference: 2014004535.CaseDesc: Jack Fraser was last seen on August 2, 2004 at his place of work in downtown Vancouver. His parents reported him missing as they had not seen or heard from him in over two weeks. He has not been seen since.

Case reference: 2012020033.CaseDesc: On November 24, 1997, Daniel Gaulton went out with some friends to the Park Hotel. He had called his place of work to take the day off from his job as a security guard at a local construction site. At approximately 9:00 p.m. Daniel went to an ATM and withdrew cash. At around 11:00 p.m. he returned home. He had a brief conversation with his roommate, and left in his 1985 Chrysler LeBaron.

Tattoo: Left Upper Arm, head of a wolf (black) set in a moon (orange)

Case reference: 2012020095.CaseDesc: On February 21, 2006, between 8:00 and 8:30 am Draper Jim was dropped off on the road by the Health Center on the Saulteaux First Nation (North of Cochin, Saskatchewan). Draper was attempting to return home to the Witchekan First Nation and has not been seen since.

Scar: Lower Lip, Left side of lower lip
Tattoo: Right Upper Arm , Ying Yang Symbol

Case reference: 2008004899.CaseDesc: Fernand Martin, also known as Fernand Boutin, last seen on the 24th April, 1964 when he visited the outpost at the north end of the Pakashkan Lake.  He was tending to his traplines in the bush near Pakashkan Lake.

Jacket: Animal Skin, light doe skin jacket
Shirt: size 33 shirt with a 15.5 inch neck

Case reference: 2014004812.CaseDesc: Grant MOFFAT attended the Fas Gas outlet at the junction of HWY 5 and PTH 68. Here he purchased a fishing license. MOFFAT was at this location for about 20 minutes and did not seem to be in a hurry. On August 20, 2006 the vehicle belonging to MOFFAT was located on HWY 481 about 3 km west of Crane River. The vehicle had not been reported stolen. The whereabouts of MOFFAT remain unknown.

Case reference: 2014001545.CaseDesc: On the morning of the 6th of August 1979, Timothy Papik and his daughter Diane left Rankin Inlet, NU. heading towards Whale Cove, NU. in a canoe. They never reached their destination and they have not been seen since.

Tattoo: Left Forearm, Knife with snake, flower

Case reference: 2014001852.CaseDesc: Ms. RUNNINGBIRD was out near Swan Lake.  She walked away from her friends and never returned.

Case reference: 2006017299.CaseDesc: On October 31, 1998, Jake Just attended a party at a residence in the north end of the town of Midland. He was last seen walking home from the party, then separating from his friends to take a short cut through a wooded area. An extensive search of the area turned up negative.

Shoes: Canvas, Black, Blue, "DVS" - skateboarder style - size 11
Backpack: Nylon, Black, Gold, jaguar logo and gold stitching
Scar: Left Upper Arm, 4" raised scar inside bicep

Case reference: 2018015227.CaseDesc: On March 22, 2018, at approximately 1:00pm, Maria Ruiz Zein was last seen in Toronto, Ontario. Maria boarded a flight to go to Colombia, but has not returned to Canada.

Case reference: 2011000198.CaseDesc: On Wednesday, November 9, 2011 at approximately 11:15 a.m., Gordon Gibbs walked away from the Greater Niagara General Hospital, where he was a patient. About 30 minutes later a witness saw a man matching Mr. Gibbs's description looking over the railing into the hydro feeder canal in the area of Portage Rd. and Morrison St., Niagara Falls. Mr. Gibbs suffers from mental health issues and dementia.

Hair: White, Short, Receding hair;white beard, moustache and sideburns

Case reference: 2014001592.CaseDesc: Robert Mc Sween was reported missing by a family member on October 14, 1994. He was last seen September 18, 1994. The last contact he had with his family was by phone at the beginning of October 1994. Details of the coming and goings of Mr. Mc Sween are unknown by family members. His vehicle was found abandoned in the yard of a restaurant in Montreal.

Case reference: 2018027643.CaseDesc: On April 17, 2008, an unidentified man was discovered in Lake Ontario, near the Shoreview Place Beach in Stoney Creek, Ontario. Biogeographic ancestry testing predicts he was of Sub-Saharan African ancestry.

Case reference: 2014004654.CaseDesc: Richard Brokke was last seen at approximately 8:10 a.m. on July 15, 2005 leaving the 7-11 Store on St. Mary's Road in Winnipeg. His vehicle was located on July 19, 2005 near St. Jean Baptiste, Manitoba. Mr. Brokke's whereabouts remain unknown.

Shirt: Denim, White, Green, Golf shirt with green stripes on front

Case reference: 2009004699.CaseDesc: On September 14, 1994, Kenneth Blais, 27 years of age, had an argument with his mother. He left his residence on Levesque Street, Sturgeon Falls, Ontario, saying he was going to meet up with his father. The family assumed that Kenneth went to the Ottawa region. Kenneth never met up with his father and is still missing.

Tattoo: Left Upper Arm, Cross done by hand

Case reference: 2010000299.CaseDesc: On September 3, 2009, Douglas Chong, 62 years of age, called his sister and advised he had attended the Toronto Western Hospital as he had not been feeling well. He advised he had been dehydrated and was sent to Seaton House to recover where he had been for three days and was feeling better. This was the last time anyone has heard from Douglas Chong. He has not retuned to his last known address. Neither Toronto Western Hospital nor Seaton House have any record of Mr. Chong having been there on or about the 3rd of September, 2009. There has been no use of his health or bank cards since September 3, 2009.

Case reference: 2012020031.CaseDesc: Michael Feist's fully operational car was found abandoned near Cherhill, Alberta.  Mr. Feist is known to have well-developed survival skills. Police investigations regarding Mr. Feist's whereabouts are currently ongoing.

Case reference: 2014003981.CaseDesc: On September 15, 1978, Wayne Kevin Spark was last seen in Richmond, British Columbia. Wayne left home to attend Vancouver Community College but never showed up. Wayne has not been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2018043199.CaseDesc: In December of 1995, Myung Lim was seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario. Myung and his wife had an argument and he told her he was returning to South Korea.

Case reference: 2012020132.CaseDesc: François Robillard's family reported his disappearance on July 16, 2010. François' associate, Guy Verdon was also reported missing around the same time.

Case reference: 2017018201.CaseDesc: Happy Charles, 42 years old, was last seen in Prince Albert, Saskatchewan, the evening of April 3rd, 2017. Happy was in frequent contact with her family in La Ronge, Saskatchewan, and had plans to seek treatment for drug addiction.

Jewelry: Grey, small silver locket with a picture of son
Purse: light in color with long straps
Jacket: Leather, Black, worn under long wool coat
Black, long wool coat worn over leather jacket
Pants: Denim, Blue, wears jeans under sweatpants

Case reference: 2014003232.CaseDesc: Warren Grundy was reported missing from Edmonton, Alberta, in June 1983. Warren's personal identification and clothing were later found near the North Saskatchewan river bank below the High Level Bridge in Edmonton. Warren may have been sighted in Ontario two and a half years after he disappeared. There was also suggestion that he may have travelled to Ohio, USA.

Case reference: 2019081392.CaseDesc: Casey Badger was last seen leaving his home in Edmonton, Alberta, on January 28, 2020. He was travelling on foot and wrapped in a blanket.

Tattoo: Left Chest, Psalms 23 on left chest
Left Cheek, Cross on left cheek
Scar: Right Forearm, Multiple scars on right forearm

Case reference: 2014004770.CaseDesc: At approximately 11:00 p.m. on April 17, 2006, Sangeeta Khanna called a family member and told him that she was going to stop at the bank and then would be home shortly. In the morning when she did not arrive the police were called. Her vehicle was located abandoned in a parking lot in Edmonton and she has not been seen since. The investigation is ongoing and investigators believe that Sangeeta may be the victim of foul play.

Case reference: 2014005313.CaseDesc: On September 24, 2007, Azelea Brown last spoke to her mother who was overseas.

Case reference: 2014004487.CaseDesc: On June 3, 2003, at approximately 9:00 a.m. a fisherman and his helper, Phillip McKay, left Berens River Manitoba to retrieve their commercial fishing nets from Sandy Bar Bay. Upon arrival, one of the nets got caught in the propeller of the boat motor, pulling the boat down. Shortly thereafter, 2 large waves capsized the boat and both men were thrown into the water. Both men were wearing oilers, making it difficult to swim. The fisherman survived and was treated for shock and hypothermia. The body of his helper, Phillip McKay was never located.  Phillip McKay is presumed dead due to drowning.

Deformity: Right Leg, Crooked, walks with a limp

Case reference: 2015011646.CaseDesc: On July 9, 1999, an adult male believed to be between the ages of 40-45 was seen by a train conductor, walking on the edge of the railway in Dorval, Quebec. A few minutes later, the adult male laid down on the railroad tracks and was crushed by the wheels of the train.

Sweater: White, Levi's brand, short sleeve T-shirt, size Large/Extra Large
Coat: Nylon, Purple, Lavender, Mauve, Windbreaker, Columbia brand

Case reference: 2006016999.CaseDesc: Donald Hemsworth was last seen in the area surrounding Twitchgrass and Hilda Lakes, Farr Township on October 8, 1974.

Case reference: 2014004308.CaseDesc: Joseph Laboucan was last seen in Peace River, Alberta, on or around August 10, 1998. He lived on the streets in Peace River and Little Buffalo, Alberta. He made occasional trips around the area as far as Edmonton.

Case reference: 2014004918.CaseDesc: On September 15th, 1993, three men were en route to Wuskwatim Lake via the Burntwood River intending to engage in commercial fishing. The men departed Nelson House, according to the only survivor they hit a rock and the motor quit. The boat was not equipped with a starter and the men were unable to restart the boat prior to going through the rapids.   Despite an intensive land, water and air search the bodies of Mr. Moose and Mr. Spence were never recovered.

Case reference: 2006018599.CaseDesc: Richard Rees and Gregory Cook were last seen on July 17, 1998, leaving Sunnyside Beach, Nottawasaga Bay in Meaford, Ontario in a Schwill DS16 sailboat. The overturned sailboat was recovered, but Richard and Gregory have not been located.

Mark: Upper Back, pale birthmark on right side

Case reference: 2014005229.CaseDesc: On March 25, 2009 at around 11:00 am, Ronald Hallam was seen for the last time on his property on Prosperity Line road in the municipality of Ashfield-Colborne-Wawanosh, Ontario.

Pants: Brown, Khaki, Light brown work pants

Case reference: 2014006231.CaseDesc: Luis Rodrigues was visiting Canada on a student visa. He was despondent over failing his classes and his visa being expired.

Case reference: 2012020156.CaseDesc: This adult male was recovered from Burrard Inlet, 1/4 mile west of Brockton Point Lighthouse, Vancouver, BC.

Case reference: 2013000027.CaseDesc: Nancy Joanne Forbes has not been seen or heard from since November 7, 2006. She was last seen at a bus stop on her way to a job interview in the Burnside Industrial Park in Dartmouth NS.

Case reference: 2020007818.CaseDesc: On August 11, 1972, at approximately 12:00pm, Harvey Tulley was seen for the last time by the building’s superintendent in Toronto, Ontario. During the time of his disappearance, Harvey was despondent.

Fractured/Broken Bones: Left Thumb, Bent towards index finger

Case reference: 2014005768.CaseDesc: On March 16, 2012, Sol Han was seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario. That day, Sol did not show up for school.

Case reference: 2014006454.CaseDesc: Jonathan Jay Wood was last seen in November 2013, in Abbotsford, British Columbia.

Case reference: 2014002270.CaseDesc: On 2 July, 1992, Behnam Amjadi was seen for the last time when he left his residence in the Côtes-des-Neiges et Notre-Dame-de-Grace district in Montreal, Quebec. Behnam has not been seen and has not contacted his ex-spouse or his brothers in Iran since.

Case reference: 2008000798.CaseDesc: Clare Kelly is schizophrenic, was not taking medications and was known to be despondent. She had a fascination with several relatives' deaths involving water. When picked up from Niagara Falls the previous week she said, "God told me to throw my body on the rocks to free my soul."

Coat: Blue, Bomber style parka with fur around the hood

Case reference: 2016034844.CaseDesc: On June 3, 2016, Derwin Beardy was seen for the last time in Winnipeg, Manitoba. During the time of his disappearance, Derwin was leading a transient lifestyle.

Shirt: Cotton, Red, White, Red t-shirt with white lettering across back, white emblem left chest

Case reference: 2006013999.CaseDesc: Walter Glynn was last seen July 23, 1980 walking southbound on Main Street, Kirkland Lake.  Mr. Glynn was heading to the A&P grocery store at the time of his disappearance.

Case reference: 2014005307.CaseDesc: On August 14, 2006, Kevin Lim, Yee Wah Eva Ho and her boyfriend Jackie Li were seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario. Kevin, Yee Wah Eva and Jackie had been friends with Philip Sit who had been reported missing in 2005. Philip’s remains were found five days prior to Eva, Kevin and Jackie’s disappearance. Philip had been the victim of a homicide.

Hair: Black, Other, Dyed red and styled with spikes

Case reference: 2014001795.CaseDesc: John Boone has been missing since December 24, 1998, in Saint John, NB. Mr. Boone suffers from depression and reportedly was not taking his medication. Mr. Boone's family is from the St Andrews, NB area.

Case reference: 2021000929.CaseDesc: On November 2, 2020, Ronald O'Kell was reported missing to the New York State Police in Niagara Falls, New York. Ronald’s unoccupied vehicle was recovered from a parking lot on Goat Island, New York. It is suspected that he may have jumped into the falls.

Case reference: 2014003393.CaseDesc: James Siwy's last confirmed contact with his family was in 1982 in the Drumheller, Alberta area.  Shortly after that, he left Alberta for Ontario with some friends.  They were traveling in Mr. Siwy's 1975 white Dodge 4 door Monaco that had a burgundy roof.  His family never heard from him again.  In 1984 Mr. Siwy's Monaco was found abandoned in Ontario and there were unconfirmed reports that he may have been hitchhiking in northern Ontario.  Mr. Siwy was reported missing by his family in 1994 when they tried to notify him of the death of a family member.

Hair: Brown, Wavy, Long, parted in the middle

Case reference: 2014005495.CaseDesc: David Harrison Powell went missing on September 22, 2010. Mr. Powell was last seen leaving his residence. His vehicle and other important property were left behind.

Fractured/Broken Bones: Right Ankle, Unhealed break, Walks with a limp

Case reference: 2014006306.CaseDesc: Shelly Dene was reported missing to the EPS by a family member on November 8, 2013. She had been out of family contact since approximately August 2013. Family is concerned for her welfare as it is unusual for her to be out of contact for this length of time. Shelly resided in Kelowna BC before moving to Edmonton in June 2013.

Case reference: 2013000104.CaseDesc: In the early morning hours of March 8, 1985, an unidentified male was seen walking on the Miles Hart Bridge. Ten minutes later, one witness returned only to discover a pile of clothing. The clothing was later identified as belonging to Mr. Beardy. It is assumed Mr. Beardy took his own life, however his remains have never been recovered. No foul play is suspected in this matter.

Case reference: 2016065869.CaseDesc: On April 11, 1976, the decomposed remains of a male individual were recovered from the water in Port Arthur Marina in the Thunder Bay Harbour. His post-mortem weight was recorded as being 170-180 lbs, however, this may not represent his actual living weight due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy. His pockets contained a red handkerchief, pipe for smoking, book of matches and a broken pencil. It is believed that he had been in the water since the fall of 1975.

Hair: Brown, receding hairline and a moustache
Ring: Silver, Aluminum, Stainless Steel, Brass ring with a silver finish on the small finger of his left hand
Scar: Right Abdomen, Long wide scar on his upper abdominal region

Case reference: 2014004857.CaseDesc: On September 21, 1992, David Neufeld, Peter Bentzen and Kenneth Vaughan were seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario. The three men had been associating with each other as “runners” in order to smuggle cigarettes into Canada from the United States by means of a boat. David’s vehicle and boat trailer were located at Ashbridges Bay, Toronto. The aging boat that was borrowed from a friend has never been recovered and the three men have not been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2014022293.CaseDesc: In February 1981, Emery LABOUCANE left his residence and went to work. While at work, he called his wife and stated he was on his way home. He never returned. His vehicle was later located at the Edmonton International Airport. LABOUCANE's credit cards were used in California over the course of the following month and then the usage ceased. No further activity was ever recorded on the credit cards.

Case reference: 2014004807.CaseDesc: On October 28, 1988, Ronald Gerard Cole went missing. He has not been heard from by family or friends since then. He was a resident of Warren, Ontario.

Case reference: 2014005629.CaseDesc: On June 23, 2011, Yoo Heo was seen for the last time at a Youth Centre in Toronto, Ontario. At the time of her disappearance, Yoo had recently arrived to Canada from Korea.

Case reference: 2013000046.CaseDesc: On June 27, 2004, Richard McGuire was seen for the last time in the Nouveau-Rosemont district of Montreal, Quebec. His vehicle was found in a garage located in the municipality of St-Elzear in the La Nouvelle-Beauce Regional County in Quebec.

Case reference: 2014004887.CaseDesc: On October 10, 2005, Ghassem Sabeiri Gilchalan was last seen in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2014001217.CaseDesc: On August 6, 2011, the body of an adult male believed to be approximately 55 years old, was found near the "La Maison du Père" homeless shelter located in the Ville-Marie district in Montreal, Quebec. This person is unknown to this organization. The man had bypass surgery for arthosclerotic heart disease in the past.

Shoes: Grey, Blue, Sportek brand running shoes; size 9

Case reference: 2014005826.CaseDesc: On June 4, 2012, the Banff RCMP were contacted by a tour company to report that Duc Dao and his son, Nguyen Dao of Vietnam did not arrive to board their bus at the scheduled time.  The two men had been staying at the Banff International Hotel and there were no personal items left in their room. The two men were due to fly back to Vietnam two days later. However, they did not board their scheduled flight and it is unknown if they returned to Vietnam.

Case reference: 2014003011.CaseDesc: In June 1980, William Dailey, an American citizen, left his home in New York State and traveled to Alaska with two friends. William was last seen in July 1980, in the Yukon on the return trip from Alaska. The men had been travelling in a 1972 Dodge dark blue flatbed pick-up truck with racks.

Case reference: 2014001664.CaseDesc: On September 12, 1982, Harold Larcher and his girlfriend set out in separate canoes with their supplies. Both canoes displayed their own leaks. After the river, they saw waves on the lake. The canoes began filling with water from these same waves.  Harold's girlfriends’ canoe sunk but she could see he was still in his canoe as she was struggling to right her own. She was unable to do so, but at one point was able to sit on top of it. Eventually she made her way to shore, however she did not see Harold again.  Numerous personal items belonging to Harold were recovered including his Passport and a life jacket that could have been his.  It is presumed Mr.Larcher drowned.

Case reference: 2018000324.CaseDesc: On October 6, 2006, Freda Whiteman was seen for the last time at the York Hotel in Edmonton, Alberta.

Case reference: 2014001767.CaseDesc: On October 15, 1991, Mario Chouinard was seen for the last time while hunting on the Zec Festubert(controlled harvesting zone) located in the municipality of Clovas in the Abitibi-Témiscamingue region of Quebec. Mario has not been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2014005988.CaseDesc: On January 29, 2013, Mark Clarke was seen for the last time in Kentville, Nova Scotia. It is out of character for Mark not to be in contact with his family for an extended period of time.

Case reference: 2012020653.CaseDesc: On May 12, 2003, Patsy Haysom was last seen when she was dropped off at the back of her residence by a friend.

Shoes: Red, Blue, BUM Equipment Logo, Slip on

Case reference: 2020040389.CaseDesc: On December 15, 1947, Rosella DeLong was seen for the last time leaving her family home in Toronto, Ontario. Rosella intended on travelling to the USA to take a course and to buy equipment to start a weight loss clinic.

Case reference: 2014004460.CaseDesc: Tsuguo Moroto left his place of business in Banff and rented a car on July 21, 1985. Several days later the vehicle was located at Panther Falls on Highway 93 North near Lake Louise, Alberta.  Several ground, aerial and waterway searches were conducted without success. Mr. Moroto was never located.

Case reference: 2012020025.CaseDesc: At about 8:15 pm on May 3, 1983, 16 year old Shelley-Anne Bacsu left a friend’s house in the Sunset Trailer Park to walk the 7 km to her home. Her route took her west on Highway 16 through Hinton, then north on Highway 40. Witnesses saw Shelley-Anne walking westbound along the shoulder of Highway 16 carrying her school books; she was not hitch-hiking. Shelley-Anne was last seen in the area of what was then the western edge of town. A dark colored van was seen in the area around the time Shelley-Anne was walking home, some reports were that it was stopped at the side of the road near where she was last seen. An extensive search for the van and/or its occupants was not successful. Several days after Shelley-Anne was last seen, some of her belongings were found near the Athabasca River not far from the outskirts of Hinton.

Case reference: 2013000090.CaseDesc: On June 16, 1983, Nicola Michel Tola was seen for the last time in Montreal, Quebec. He was suppose to come home and make dinner but he was never seen again by his family. His car was located at the Pie IX shopping mall.

Case reference: 2014001690.CaseDesc: On December 7, 1971, James MacDonald departed Thompson, Manitoba in his "Money Mark 21" aircraft bound for Winnipeg. James never arrived. Despite intensive air search neither Mr. MacDonald nor his aircraft have been located.

Jewelry: Metal, Silver, Aluminum, Stainless Steel, engineering ring
Metal, Silver, Aluminum, Stainless Steel, Calendar watch

Case reference: 2014001521.CaseDesc: On November 3, 1972, a helicopter carrying a pilot and three passengers went missing in Lake Winnipeg. The helicopter left Thompson, Manitoba at 3:20 p.m. and was heading for Winnipeg after stopping at a number of communities. The helicopter landed at Warren's Landing at approximately 5:20 p.m., and left for Winnipeg. The pilot reported that the weather was poor and he estimated his arrival in Winnipeg at 8:00 p.m. At 5:50 p.m. there was radio contact with the pilot where he stated that he was over Poplar River. This was the last radio contact with this helicopter. The Canadian Air Search and Rescue, private aircraft and police aircraft searched until November 17, 1972 when the search was suspended until the spring of 1973. Nathan Kryger and Ian Fraser are presumed dead as a result of the helicopter crash. Foul play is not suspected.

Case reference: 2020015970.CaseDesc: On August 31, 2017, John Spratt was seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario. John is known to be homeless, and has been diagnosed with some serious health issues. John would always check in with his family every couple of years, however, they have not heard from him since 2017.

Case reference: 2006005199.CaseDesc: On Friday, July 1, 2005, at about 3:00 p.m., Laura Flanagan left her cottage to paddle her canoe around Hall's Lake. She was seen by neighbours to be alone in the canoe. A search of the lake located her canoe washed up on the east side of the lake. A further search of the lake failed to locate Ms. Flanagan.

Bathing Suit: Blue, Green, One piece, floral pattern

Case reference: 2014004671.CaseDesc: Murphy Quill was last seen in mid-July 2005. His family and friends are concerned for his well being as it is unusual for him to be out of contact for this length of time. Although he does not have a fixed address, Mr. Quill is known to frequent the Main Street strip and the area near 75 Martha Street in Winnipeg, MB.

Case reference: 2018063244.CaseDesc: On June 9, 2001, at approximately 11:00 a.m., Marilyn Payne was seen for the last time when she left the hostel she was staying at.

Case reference: 2014004672.CaseDesc: On the 13th of June, 1995, Marcel Legris and a friend were last seen fishing on Cold Lake, SK. A large storm suddenly came up and it is believed swamped the boat they were using. The friend’s body was located, however, Mr. Legris was never found.

Case reference: 2020010648.CaseDesc: On September 9, 1992, at approximately 9:00pm, Harry White was seen for the last time as he left his father’s residence in Toronto, Ontario. Harry’s boat was later found in Bluffer’s Park with the engine still running.

Case reference: 2014005066.CaseDesc: James Douglas Turnball or Turnbull was last seen on the MV Princess of Vancouver vessel commuting from Nanaimo to Vancouver in the waters of the Howe Sound in 1966. Bowen Island RCMP are seeking any next of kin or close relations for the missing male.

Jewelry: Gold, Yellow, Black, black diamond ring
Gold, Yellow, Brown, Timex watch with leather strap

Case reference: 2006011899.CaseDesc: Mr. McKay was last seen outside "Clarkes Tavern" in Sioux Lookout, Ontario on December 22, 1987.

Case reference: 2020003796.CaseDesc: In the afternoon of March 1, 1992, Ronald Bax was seen for the last time in Carcross, Yukon. That evening, Ronald last spoke with a friend on the telephone.

Mark: Neck, Mole on front left side of neck
Tattoo: Right Upper Arm , Pegasus, winged horse

Case reference: 2006004499.CaseDesc: James Pearce was last seen in the Grafton area on October 5, 1999. On October 8, 1999, his 1949 pink Dodge pick-up truck was located at the Cobourg train station parking lot.

Hair: Brown, Straight, Brush Cut, Recent #2 cut at time of disappearance
Tattoo: Right Hand, Banner with the name Laurie
Left Arm, Skeleton with top hat
Scar: Torso (Back), Numerous scars from an accident
Head, A 1 inch scar under hair on left side
Left Leg, Scar from a fracture

Case reference: 1993001330.CaseDesc: Darlene was last seen at home.

Case reference: 2018022854.CaseDesc: Karrissa Koks was reported missing on April 30, 2018. However, she has not been seen or heard from by friends or family since October 7, 2017.

Hair: Brown, Shoulder, Changes hair style and colour often

Case reference: 2018047905.CaseDesc: On August 12, 2018, an unidentified man was discovered on Highway 417, near the Pinecrest overpass on Greenbank Road, in Ottawa, Ontario. The man was riding a black “Louis Garneau” ten-speed mountain bike, with a red water bottle holder, and a pink cable lock. Biogeographic ancestry testing predicts he was of European ancestry.

Case reference: 2008004499.CaseDesc: Paul Lanteigne was last seen on July 19, 1990. He telephoned his wife on July 20 to advise her he was leaving Cranberry Marina at 6:00 p.m. to return to the Dyconia Hotel in Wasaga Beach in his boat. The boat was recovered overturned in Georgian Bay, and a search was conducted. Grey deck shoes belonging to Mr. Lanteigne were found on the beach on July 21, 1990, but nothing else was recovered.
